main.name: Ashwin Chembu
main.description: This portfolio showcases my journey as a dedicated web developer and computer science student at UC Davis, highlighting my hands-on experience across various technical roles, academic achievements at both UC Davis and UC Santa Cruz, and my certifications in data science and cloud computing
main.bio: I am a passionate and motivated web developer with a strong foundation in computer science and engineering. I am transferred from UC Santa Cruz, where I achieved Dean's Honors and earned certifications in data science and cloud computing.

resume.skillmessage: A proficient software developer and data analyst with expertise in front-end and back-end technologies, machine learning, and data-driven research. Skilled in React, NextJS, Python, Java, and more. Experienced in developing full-stack applications, conducting quality assurance, and implementing machine learning algorithms for predictive modeling.

education.description: Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science with a strong academic record (3.85 GPA). Actively involved in projects and research that leverage the latest technologies and methodologies in the field.

work.title: Data Engineer Intern
work.description: Gained comprehensive expertise in Azure services and Databricks Lakehouse Platform, significantly enhancing data management and analysis workflows by 40%. Skillfully improved data transformation and analytics using Azure Databricks and Apache Spark, leading to a 25% increase in project efficiency, and developed a deep understanding of managing Azure environments and building data lakes, resulting in a 30% decrease in data retrieval and processing times. Applied Lakehouse Architecture principles for efficient data organization, enhancing processing efficiency by 20%, and became proficient in creating insightful Power BI reports and dashboards, boosting data-driven decision-making for clients by 35%

work.title: Data Analyst Researcher
work.description: Conducted extensive research under Professor David Lee's mentorship, leveraging advanced data science tools to analyze the impact of technology on social issues and enhanced the robustness of data systems using SQL and NoSQL, maintaining high standards of data quality for more reliable insights. Implemented statistical analysis and data modeling with Python, improving the precision of social impact initiatives by 20%, and utilized machine learning to predict tech-related social challenges, enhancing understanding and potential solutions by 25%. Collaborated with interdisciplinary teams, employing tools like PowerBI for dynamic data visualization, which facilitated clearer communication of complex findings to stakeholders.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Transformed Figma design mockups into dynamic frontend components using React, ensuring a seamless user experience, and integrated Fullstack development tools (Firebase, Express, React, Node.js) for efficient user data management, improving application performance by 30%. Utilized React for building responsive and interactive user interfaces, employed Redux for efficient state management, and developed scalable RESTful APIs with Node.js and Express, focusing on robust security, enhancing data security by 25%. Enhanced application performance and user satisfaction by 20% through implementing React Router for dynamic and seamless navigation within the single-page application.

projects.title: Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon (C++ only)
